abstract: Updated: The Supreme Court ruled that the convictions of Jeffrey Skilling and Conrad Black were flawed, finding fault in interpretations of the statutes used to prosecute them.
snippet: Updated: The Supreme Court ruled that the convictions of Jeffrey Skilling and Conrad Black were flawed, finding fault in interpretations of the statutes used to prosecute them.
lead_paragraph: 2:23 p.m. | Updated The New York Times’s Adam Liptak provides more details on the Supreme Court’s ruling.

headline.main: Supreme Court Finds Fault in Skilling and Black Rulings
